name: Sterling Township Supervisors v. Wayne County Commissioners, Appellants
name_abbreviation: Sterling Township Supervisors v. Wayne County Commissioners

judges: Before Brown, C. J., Potter, StewARir.y' Frazer and Walling, JJ.
parties: Sterling Township Supervisors v. Wayne County Commissioners, Appellants.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mb. Justice Stewabt,
This case was beard in tbe court below and argued bere on appeal witb tbe case of Supervisors of Manchester Township v. Wayne County, in which tbe opinion has, just been banded down, affirming tbe judgment appealed from. Tbe facts are tbe same in both cases and tbe question raised is tbe same in each. It follows that like disposition is to be made of this.
Tbe assignments are overruled and tbe judgment is affirmed.
opinions.author: Mb. Justice Stewabt,

attorneys: Charles A. McCfarty and M. E. Simons, for appellants.
E. C. Mumford, witb bim J. 0. Mumford, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Sterling Township Supervisors v. Wayne County Commissioners, Appellants.
Argued Feb. 19,1917.
Appeal, No. 304, Jan. T., 1916, by defendant, from order of C. P. Wayne Co., June T., 1916, No. 28, awarding mandamus, in case of The Supervisors of Sterling Township v. The Commissioners of Wayne County.
Before Brown, C. J., Potter, StewARir.y' Frazer and Walling, JJ.
Affirmed.
Petition for Mandamus. Before Searle, P. J.
The facts appear in Manchester Township Supervisors v. Wayne County Commissioners, 257 Pa. 442.
The court on final bearing awarded tbe mandamus as prayed for. Defendants appealed.
Error assigned was in awarding tbe mandamus.
Charles A. McCfarty and M. E. Simons, for appellants.
E. C. Mumford, witb bim J. 0. Mumford, for appellee.
April 16, 1917:
